results.title: The Valley is ours
results.creator_credit: Stanley Hawes, John Heyer and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This classic documentary celebrates the variety of activities the Murray River and the surrounding district sustains: from agriculture to timber, fishing to mining, fruit picking to shipbuilding. There is a special focus on the optimistic spirit of the people of the region as they overcome problems of erosion, bushfire and drought and makes a plea for further development, arguing that at least another million people could find happy homes in this fertile territory.

results.title: The Unlucky country
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Denys Brown and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: South Vietnam, a developing country facing the process of improving standards of living, health and education, against a background of constant dissension and war - the dual objectives to win a war and develop a country. Discusses the role of Australian Task Forces in establishing security and providing aid for civil development. Shows the work of the three medical teams.

results.title: Facts
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Communication”.
A change in working hours upsets the workers at a factory and Dixon, the Union delegate, is asked to report the change to the union office. In his report to the organiser, Dixon manages to bring in all sorts of irrelevancies but is very short on accurate information. This film manages to pinpoint an area of possible confusion if union delegates fail to get the facts straight.

results.title: Understanding the car
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Drive”
Some knowledge of how a car works is a good basis for the intelligent use of its controls, and that is an early important step towards becoming a good driver. A car is built, pictorially, in simple stages, and how each component operates is explained in simple terms.

results.title: Under stress
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Examines the re-organisation of mental health services in Australia. Presents some of the changes that have shaped the treatment of the mentally ill in the second part of the 20th century. Patients are no longer admitted and forgotten. Modern and renovated hospitals prepare patients to take their place in the world again, whilst early treatment centres and out-patient clinics have been established. We meet patients in various centres and see them preparing for a new start in life. Photographed by Reg Pearse; music by Peter Sculthorpe; sound by Barry Bowden.

results.title: Two boys and a boat
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason, Shan Benson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The story of how two boys acquire a V.J. sailing boat by joining a club on the shores of Sydney Harbour and the way in which they are taught to sail their craft in safety.

results.title: Training champions
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The methods used by well known Australian coaches including Frank Guthrie, Harry Gallagher and Forbes Carlyle in training present and future swimming champions. Underwater photography is used to show the action of Lorraine Crapp, David Thiele and Murray Rose.

results.title: Time and place
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A study of our living environment in all its variety. Capturing the mood of today’s living, grasping at images of a graceful, more leisurely past, and examining alternative paths into the future. Without commentary, this deeply perceptive film establishes a basis for comparison of environmental situations, and asks the viewer to make their own choice. Begins with the documentation of Christo’s wrapping of the Sydney cove coastline (shot through a rose coloured lens in the final scenes).

results.title: Timber town
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Looks at life in a timber town located in the hardwood forest area of the southwestern coast of Western Australia. Shows Karri forests, tree felling, reforestation, controlled burning of undergrowth, timber hauling and milling. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
